javadoc: Address map interface add methods need by the program database implementation to manage its address map. NOTE: Objects implementing this interface are not intended for use outside of the ghidra.program.database packages.

methods.javadoc:
Get the database key associated with the given relative address.
 This key uniquely identifies a relative location within the program.
 If the program's image base is moved to another address, this key will map to a new
 address that is the same distance to the new base as the old address was to the old base.
 If the requested key does not exist and create is false, INVALID_ADDRESS_KEY
 will be returned.  Note that nothing should ever be stored using the returned key unless
 create is true.
@param addr the address for which to get a database key.
@param create true if a new key may be generated
@return the database key for the given address or INVALID_ADDRESS_KEY if 
 create is false and one does not exist for the specified addr.
methods.name: getKey
methods.comment:
Get the database key associated with the given relative address.
 This key uniquely identifies a relative location within the program.
 If the program's image base is moved to another address, this key will map to a new
 address that is the same distance to the new base as the old address was to the old base.
 If the requested key does not exist and create is false, INVALID_ADDRESS_KEY
 will be returned.  Note that nothing should ever be stored using the returned key unless
 create is true.

params.name: addr
params.comment: the address for which to get a database key.

params.name: create
params.comment: true if a new key may be generated

return.comment:
the database key for the given address or INVALID_ADDRESS_KEY if 
 create is false and one does not exist for the specified addr.

methods.name: getAbsoluteEncoding
methods.comment:
Get the database key associated with the given absolute address.
 This key uniquely identifies an absolute location within the program.
 If the requested key does not exist and create is false, INVALID_ADDRESS_KEY
 will be returned.  Note that nothing should ever be stored using the returned key unless
 create is true.

params.name: addr
params.comment: the address for which to get a database key.

params.name: create
params.comment: true if a new key may be generated

return.comment:
the database key for the given address or INVALID_ADDRESS_KEY if 
 create is false and one does not exist for the specified addr.

methods.javadoc: Search for addr within the "sorted" keyRangeList and return the index of the keyRange which contains the specified addr. @param keyRangeList @param addr address or null @return index of the keyRange within the keyRangeList which contains addr if it is contained in the list; otherwise, (-(insertion point) - 1). The insertion point is defined as the point at which the addr would be inserted into the list: the index of the first keyRange greater than addr, or keyRangeList.size(), if all keyRanges in the list are less than the specified addr. Note that this guarantees that the return value will be >= 0 if and only if the addr is found within a keyRange. An addr of null will always result in a returned index of -1.
methods.name: findKeyRange
methods.comment:
Search for addr within the "sorted" keyRangeList and return the index of the
 keyRange which contains the specified addr.

params.name: addr
params.comment: address or null

return.comment:
index of the keyRange within the keyRangeList which contains addr 
 if it is contained in the list; otherwise, (-(insertion point) - 1). 
 The insertion point is defined as the point at which the
 addr would be inserted into the list: the index of the first keyRange
 greater than addr, or keyRangeList.size(), if all
 keyRanges in the list are less than the specified addr.  Note
 that this guarantees that the return value will be = 0 if
 and only if the addr is found within a keyRange.  
 An addr of null will always result in a returned index of -1.

methods.name: getKeyRanges
methods.comment:
Generates a properly ordered list of database key ranges for a
 a specified address range.  If absolute encodings are requested, 
 only memory addresses will be included.  Returned key ranges are 
 generally intended for read-only operations since new keys will 
 never be generated.  The returned key ranges will correspond 
 to those key ranges which have previously been created within 
 the specified address range and may represent a much smaller subset 
 of addresses within the specified range.

params.name: start
params.comment: minimum address of range

params.name: end
params.comment: maximum address of range

params.name: create
params.comment:
true if a new keys may be generated, otherwise returned 
 key-ranges will be limited to those already defined.

methods.name: getKeyRanges
methods.comment:
Generates a properly ordered list of database key ranges for a
 a specified address set.  If absolute encodings are requested, 
 only memory addresses will be included.

params.name: set
params.comment: address set or null for all real address.

params.name: create
params.comment:
true if a new keys may be generated, otherwise returned 
 key-ranges will be limited to those already defined.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the address that was used to generate the given long key. (If the image base was
 moved, then a different address is returned unless the value was encoded using the
 "absoluteEncoding" method.  If the program's default address space is segmented (i.e., SegmentedAddressSpace).
 the address returned will be always be normalized to defined segmented memory blocks if possible.
@param value the long value to convert to an address.
methods.name: decodeAddress
methods.comment:
Returns the address that was used to generate the given long key. (If the image base was
 moved, then a different address is returned unless the value was encoded using the
 "absoluteEncoding" method.  If the program's default address space is segmented (i.e., SegmentedAddressSpace).
 the address returned will be always be normalized to defined segmented memory blocks if possible.

params.name: value
params.comment: the long value to convert to an address.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the address factory associated with this map.
 Null may be returned if map not associated with a specific address factory.
methods.name: getAddressFactory
methods.comment:
Returns the address factory associated with this map.
 Null may be returned if map not associated with a specific address factory.

methods.name: getKeyRanges
methods.comment:
Generates a properly ordered list of database key ranges for a
 a specified address range.  If absolute encodings are requested, 
 only memory addresses will be included.

params.name: start
params.comment: minimum address of range

params.name: end
params.comment: maximum address of range

params.name: absolute
params.comment:
if true, absolute key encodings are returned, otherwise 
 standard/relocatable address key encodings are returned.

params.name: create
params.comment:
true if a new keys may be generated, otherwise returned 
 key-ranges will be limited to those already defined.

methods.name: getKeyRanges
methods.comment:
Generates a properly ordered list of database key ranges for a
 a specified address set.  If absolute encodings are requested, 
 only memory addresses will be included.

params.name: set
params.comment: address set or null for all real address.

params.name: absolute
params.comment:
if true, absolute key encodings are returned, otherwise 
 standard/relocatable address key encodings are returned.

params.name: create
params.comment:
true if a new keys may be generated, otherwise returned 
 key-ranges will be limited to those already defined.

methods.javadoc: Returns an address map capable of decoding old address encodings.
methods.name: getOldAddressMap
methods.comment: Returns an address map capable of decoding old address encodings.

methods.javadoc: Returns true if this address map has been upgraded.
methods.name: isUpgraded
methods.comment: Returns true if this address map has been upgraded.

methods.javadoc:
Sets the image base, effectively changing the mapping between addresses and longs.
@param base the new base address.
methods.name: setImageBase
methods.comment: Sets the image base, effectively changing the mapping between addresses and longs.

params.name: base
params.comment: the new base address.

methods.javadoc:
Returns a modification number that always increases when the address map base table has
 changed.
methods.name: getModCount
methods.comment:
Returns a modification number that always increases when the address map base table has
 changed.

methods.javadoc: Returns the current image base setting.
methods.name: getImageBase
methods.comment: Returns the current image base setting.

methods.name: setLanguage
methods.comment: Converts the current base addresses to addresses compatible with the new language.

params.name: newLanguage
params.comment: the new language to use.

params.name: addrFactory
params.comment: the new AddressFactory.

params.name: translator
params.comment: translates address spaces from the old language to the new language.

methods.javadoc:
Clears any cached values.
@throws IOException
methods.name: invalidateCache
methods.comment: Clears any cached values.

methods.name: renameOverlaySpace
methods.comment: Rename an existing overlay space.

params.name: oldName
params.comment: old overlay name

params.name: newName
params.comment: new overlay name (must be unique among all space names within this map)

methods.name: deleteOverlaySpace
methods.comment: Delete the specified overlay space from this address map.

params.name: name
params.comment: overlay space name (must be unique among all space names within this map)

methods.name: hasSameKeyBase
methods.comment:
Returns true if the two address keys share a common key base and can be 
 used within a single key-range.

methods.name: isKeyRangeMin
methods.comment:
Returns true if the specified addrKey is the minimum key within
 its key-range.

methods.name: isKeyRangeMax
methods.comment:
Returns true if the specified addrKey is the maximum key within
 its key-range.

name: AddressMap
comment:
Address map interface add methods need by the program database implementation to manage its address map.
 NOTE: Objects implementing this interface are not intended for use outside of the
 ghidra.program.database packages.

fields.javadoc: Reserved key for an invalid key.
fields.name: INVALID_ADDRESS_KEY
fields.comment: Reserved key for an invalid key.
